summary:
🔬 Experienced Science Teacher | Chemistry Specialist | Building Professional Connections 🔬

📚 About Me 📚

Hello! I'm Dan, a seasoned science educator deeply committed to fostering professional relationships and sharing insights with fellow educators and professionals. With over 6 years of dedicated teaching experience, I've had the privilege of making a positive impact on the lives of countless students and growing within the field of science education.

🧪 Specialization 🧪

My expertise is in chemistry education, where I excel at making complex chemical concepts accessible and engaging. Whether it's simplifying the periodic table, exploring chemical reactions, or delving into organic chemistry, I thrive on creating dynamic learning environments that ignite students' curiosity.

📊 Current Role: Subject Coordinator for MYP Chemistry 📊

I currently serve as a Subject Coordinator for MYP (Middle Years Programme) Chemistry, where I play a leadership role in curriculum development and implementation. Collaborating with educators to align our curriculum with the MYP framework, I aim to foster an environment that encourages exploration and inquiry in the world of science.

🔗 Let's Connect 🔗

I'm passionate about connecting with fellow educators, professionals, and enthusiasts in the field of science education. Whether you'd like to exchange ideas, share best practices, or explore potential collaborations, I'm here to build meaningful connections.

🌐 Connect with me on LinkedIn to join the conversation and expand our professional networks.

Thank you for visiting my profile, and I look forward to connecting with like-minded professionals who share a dedication to science education and a commitment to advancing our collective knowledge and impact.

awards.title: Open University Post Graduate Poster Competition
awards.description: Winner of Peoples Choice award and best in category (life health and chemical sciences)

profile_positions.description: As the current MYP (Middle Years Programme) Chemistry Subject Coordinator, I lead and manage the development and implementation of the MYP chemistry curriculum. My responsibilities include curriculum design, assessment development, and faculty collaboration to ensure the highest standards of education in chemistry.
profile_positions.title: Subject Coordinator MYP Chemistry

profile_positions.description: In my current role as an MYP (Middle Years Programme) Physics and Chemistry Teacher, I deliver engaging and comprehensive instruction in both subjects. My aim is to inspire students to explore the fascinating world of physics and chemistry, fostering a deep understanding of scientific principles and critical thinking skills.
profile_positions.title: Physics and Chemistry teacher

profile_positions.description:
During my time as a Substitute Teacher at Finham Park 2, I played a crucial role in ensuring the continuity of education and providing support to students in various subjects. My commitment to facilitating a positive learning environment and adaptability were key in this role.

Substitute Teacher Responsibilities:

Subject Versatility: Teaching a wide range of subjects, I provided students with the guidance and knowledge they needed to excel in their coursework.

Classroom Management: Effectively managing classroom dynamics, I ensured a productive and respectful learning atmosphere, even in diverse and ever-changing educational settings.

Adaptive Teaching: Quickly adapting to different grade levels and teaching styles allowed for a seamless transition in the absence of the regular teacher.

Supportive Mentorship: Offering support to students, I provided additional help when required, and maintained a strong focus on their academic progress and overall well-being.

Communication: Open and transparent communication with both students and staff was a priority, ensuring a cohesive learning experience for everyone involved.

My experience as a Substitute Teacher has equipped me with the flexibility and resilience needed to excel in dynamic educational environments. I am passionate about contributing to the growth and success of students and look forward to future opportunities in education.
profile_positions.title: Substitute Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Science Teacher: I taught both GCSE and A-level Chemistry, providing students with a strong foundation in scientific principles and nurturing their academic growth. My approach emphasized hands-on learning and critical thinking to ensure their success in these demanding subjects.

Head of House: As Head of House, I led our house to victory in the House Cup competition during my first year. I was committed to creating a tight-knit community within my house, mentoring students, fostering teamwork, and facilitating personal growth.

Duke of Edinburgh Coordinator: In my role as the Duke of Edinburgh Coordinator, I guided students through the Duke of Edinburgh Award program, encouraging them to develop essential life skills, resilience, leadership abilities, and a passion for adventure.

I am proud of the accomplishments and lasting impact I had at [Name of Previous School] and am eager to apply the skills and experiences gained in this role to future endeavours.

#ScienceEducation #StudentDevelopment #DukeofEdinburgh #EducationLeadership
profile_positions.title: Science Teacher and Head of House

profile_positions.description:
During my time as a PGCE (Postgraduate Certificate in Education) student at Warwick University, I underwent rigorous training that included full-time placements in two different schools. This intensive program was designed to equip me with the essential skills and knowledge needed to become an effective educator.

Key Highlights:

Full-Time School Placements: As part of my PGCE training, I immersed myself in two distinct school environments, gaining practical experience and exposure to diverse teaching methodologies.

Pedagogical Development: At Warwick University, I received comprehensive training in pedagogy, curriculum design, and educational theory. This knowledge formed the foundation of my teaching practice.

Reflective Teaching: Throughout the program, I cultivated a habit of reflective teaching, constantly assessing and refining my instructional approaches to best meet the needs of my students.

Collaborative Learning: Collaborating with peers and experienced educators at Warwick University enriched my understanding of the education field and fostered a supportive learning community.

My time as a PGCE student at Warwick University was instrumental in my journey to becoming an effective and dedicated educator, and it prepared me for the challenges and rewards of a career in teaching.
profile_positions.title: PGCE student

profile_positions.description:
As a dedicated Support Worker, I provided crucial assistance and care to adults with special needs, fostering an environment of compassion, respect, and empowerment.

Key Responsibilities:

Personalized Care: Tailored support to meet the unique needs of each individual, promoting their independence and well-being.

Skill Development: Facilitated skill-building activities and encouraged personal growth, enhancing the daily lives of those I worked with.

Effective Communication: Established open and empathetic communication channels to ensure that individuals' preferences and concerns were heard and addressed.

Safety and Comfort: Ensured a safe and comfortable living environment, consistently monitoring for any health or safety concerns.

Collaborative Approach: Collaborated with multidisciplinary teams, including healthcare professionals, to provide holistic care and support.

My role as a Support Worker allowed me to make a meaningful impact on the lives of adults with special needs, promoting their dignity and quality of life. I am passionate about creating a positive and inclusive space for those I serve
profile_positions.title: Support Worker

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a tutor at The Brilliant Club, I had the privilege of working with two schools during the spring and summer. The primary mission of The Brilliant Club is to widen participation and offer students a glimpse of higher education.

Key Contributions:

Bespoke Science Syllabus: I meticulously designed a tailored science syllabus, specifically crafted to engage and educate pupils aged 15-17 years old. This syllabus aimed to instill a passion for learning and a deeper understanding of scientific concepts.

Enhancing Access to Higher Education: By imparting knowledge and fostering critical thinking skills, I actively contributed to The Brilliant Club's mission of empowering students to explore the world of higher education, breaking down barriers and expanding their horizons.

My experience as a tutor at The Brilliant Club allowed me to make a meaningful impact on young minds, bridging the gap between secondary education and higher learning, and inspiring students to pursue their academic aspirations.
profile_positions.title: Tutor

profile_positions.description: As a PhD student, my research at the intersection of cancer chemistry, physical chemistry, and analytical chemistry focuses on utilizing a combination of analytical methods to measure Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) released from the skin. The ultimate goal of my work is to establish VOCs as potential biomarkers for the diagnosis of malignant melanoma.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

volunteer_experiences.description: I was responsible for running the meetings as well as the day to day running of the group for the time that I was there. I was involved personally with the organisation of a fundraising event and also set up and ran the groups twitter account
